intro: Eureiandra somalensis, commonly known as the Somali eureiandra, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa, particularly Somalia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
